text: hi I'm Gareth Edwards I'm the director
of Godzilla this is what we called a
halo jump which stands for high altitude
low opening it's when parachute and
divers pull their chute very late from a
very high altitude above the sky we're
following Aaron taylor-johnson who plays
forward they are jumping out of a plane
which for these particular shots was a
parked plane on a runway in Hawaii but
the shot you're about to see next is
pure digital as they run out of the
plane they decided it was easier to
completely computer-generated this shot
than to start from scratch and cut
around real people it was a combination
of using computer graphics like this
particular shot is completely
computer-generated and whereas this shot
is real footage of real skydivers in
Paris in California
and they would cut around the skydivers
and add the environment so that it was
always this sort of stormy clouds those
clouds weren't really there is actually
a desert on a beautiful clear day this
is green screen so this is Aaron in a
studio on wires and they get removed and
they add in the clouds around him we
just tried to draw lots of different
imagery that seemed epic and it was a
little bit like a symbolic thing of
angels descending into hell that the
whole Dante's Inferno side of things we
were trying to capture that vibe this
works really well I think in IMAX 3d you
really feel like you're falling with
them it's one of my favorite sequences
in the movie
[Music]
